block.p: Elizabeth Alice Lynch, a daughter of Gay and Gerald Lynch of Manhattan, was married yesterday to Kevin Joseph Mulhearn, the son of Theresa and Joseph Mulhearn of Stratford, N.J. The Rev. Francis McKee performed the ceremony at Queen of the Most Holy Rosary Roman Catholic Church in Bridgehampton, N.Y.
The couple graduated from Haverford College, where they met on a blind date their freshman year.

Elizabeth Alice Lynch, a daughter of Gay and Gerald Lynch of Manhattan, was married yesterday to Kevin Joseph Mulhearn, the son of Theresa and Joseph Mulhearn of Stratford, N.J. The Rev. Francis McKee performed the ceremony at Queen of the Most Holy Rosary Roman Catholic Church in Bridgehampton, N.Y.
The couple graduated from Haverford College, where they met on a blind date their freshman year.

Ms. Lynch, 24, is keeping her name. She recently completed her first year of studies for a master's degree in international affairs at Columbia University. Her father is president of the John Jay College of Criminal Justice in Manhattan, where he is also a professor of psychology. Her mother is the librarian at the Buckley School in Manhattan.

Mr. Mulhearn, 25, is a museum educator at the Brooklyn Museum of Art. Until last year, he was a press secretary for Representative Darlene Hooley of Oregon. His mother teaches French at Sterling High School in Somerdale, N.J. His father is a photographic sales consultant at MidCity Camera, a store in Philadelphia.
